ARABIC: قَالَ رَبِّ فَأَنظِرْنِىٓ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: He said, 'My Lord, grant me a reprieve until the Day they are raised again.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: He said: "O Lord, give me respite till the day the dead rise from their graves."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Satan said: “My Lord, then grant me respite till the Day that they are raised up.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: He said, "Lord, grant me respite until the Day of Resurrection".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: He said, “My Lord! Therefore give me respite till the day when all will be raised.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: [Iblis] said: "My Lord! Give me then respite till the Day the (dead) are resurrected."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: He said: My Lord! then respite me to the day that they are raised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Said he, 'My Lord, respite me till the day they shall be raised.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: He said: My Lord! Reprieve me till the day when they are raised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: But Satan said, "My Lord, grant me respite until the Day of Resurrection,"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: He said: my Lord! respite me till the Day whereon they are raised up.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: He said, ‘My Lord! Respite me till the day they will be resurrected.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: (Iblis) said: "O my Lord! Give me then respite till the Day the (dead) are raised."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: [Iblis (Satan)] said: "My Lord! Give me then respite till the Day the (dead) are resurrected."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: He (satan) replied: 'Respite me my Lord till the Day of Resurrection'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: He said, “Lord, defer me until the Day they are resurrected.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: He said, "My Lord, then reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [38:79] He said, ‘My Lord, then reprieve me until the day when they, mankind, will be raised’.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (He said) Iblis said: (My Lord!) my Lord! (Reprieve me) give me a respite (till the day when they are raised) from the graves. The wicked one wanted to escape the taste of death.
